MAP.name: ANGLE
MAP.help: Angle, given in degrees, to rotate the map. Default is 0. The rendered map will rotate in a clockwise direction

MAP.name: DEFRESOLUTION
MAP.help: Sets the reference resolution (pixels per inch) used for symbology. Default is 72. Used to automatically scale the symbology when RESOLUTION is changed, so the map maintains the same look at each resolution. The scale factor is RESOLUTION / DEFRESOLUTION

MAP.name: EXTENT
MAP.help: The spatial extent of the map to be created. In most cases you will need to specify this, although MapServer can sometimes (expensively) calculate one if it is not specified.

MAP.name: IMAGETYPE
MAP.help: Output format (raster or vector) to generate. The name used here must match the “NAME” of a user defined or internally available OUTPUTFORMAT.

MAP.name: MAXSIZE
MAP.help: Sets the maximum size of the map image. This will override the default value. For example, setting this to 4096 means that you can have up to 4096 pixels in both dimensions (i.e. max of 4096x4096). Default is 4096.

MAP.name: NAME
MAP.help: Prefix attached to map, scalebar and legend GIF filenames created using this mapfile. It should be kept short.

MAP.name: RESOLUTION
MAP.help: Sets the pixels per inch for output, only affectsscale computations. Default is 72

MAP.name: SIZE
MAP.help: Size in pixels of the output image (i.e. the map)

MAP.name: STATUS
MAP.help: Is the map active? Sometimes you may wish to turn this off to use only the reference map or scale bar

MAP.name: UNITS
MAP.help: Units of the map coordinates. Used for scalebar and scale computations

WEB.name: EMPTY
WEB.help: URL to forward users to if a query fails. If not defined the value for ERROR is used.

WEB.name: ERROR
WEB.help: URL to forward users to if a query fails. If not defined the value for ERROR is used.

WEB.name: BROWSEFORMAT
WEB.help: Format of the interface output, using MapServer CGI. The default value is [text/html].

WEB.name: MAXSCALEDENOM
WEB.help: Minimum scale at which this interface is valid. When a user requests a map at a smaller scale, MapServer automatically returns the map at this scale. This effectively prevents user from zooming too far out. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

WEB.name: MINSCALEDENOM
WEB.help: Maximum scale at which this LAYER is drawn. When a user reqests a map at a larger scale, MapServer automatically returns the map at this scale. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

WEB.name: ZOOM-LEVEL
WEB.help: Zoom level at which this LAYER is drawn.

WEB.name: QUERYFORMAT
WEB.help: Format of the query output. (added to MapServer 4.8.0) This works for mode=query (using query templates in CGI mode), but not for mode=browse. The default value is text/html.

PROJECTION.help: To set up projections you must define one projection object for the output image (in the MAP object) and one projection object for each layer (in the LAYER objects) to be projected.

LAYER.name: GRID
LAYER.help: The GRID object can be used to add labeled graticule lines to your map

LAYER.name: CLASSGROUP
LAYER.help: Specify the class's group that would be considered at rendering time. The CLASS object's GROUP parameter must be used in combination with CLASSGROUP

LAYER.name: CLASSITEM
LAYER.help: Item name in attribute table to use for class lookups.

LAYER.name: CONNECTION
LAYER.help: Database connection string to retrieve remote data.

LAYER.name: DATA
LAYER.help: If this is a PostGIS layer, the parameter should be in the form of <columnname> from <tablename>, where columnname is the name of the column containing the geometry objects and [tablename] is the name of the table from which the geometry data will be read.

LAYER.name: ENCODING
LAYER.help: The encoding used for text in the layer data source. The value must be supported by ICONV (for example [LATIN1]). When ENCODING is set (and not equal to UTF-8), the data source text attributes will be converted to UTF-8

LAYER.name: EXTENT
LAYER.help: [minx] [miny] [maxx] [maxy]: The spatial extent of the data. In most cases you will not need to specify this, but it can be used to avoid the speed cost of having MapServer compute the extents of the data. An application can also possibly use this value to override the extents of the map.

LAYER.name: FILTER
LAYER.help: This parameter allows for data specific attribute filtering that is done at the same time spatial filtering is done, but before any CLASS expressions are evaluated. The string is simply a MapServer expression.

LAYER.name: FILTERITEM
LAYER.help: Item to use with simple FILTER expressions. OGR and shapefiles only. DO NOT USE WITH POSTGIS

LAYER.name: GEOMTRANSFORM
LAYER.help: Used to indicate that the current feature will be transformed (buffer,simplify,simplifypt,generalize,smoothsia)

LAYER.name: GROUP
LAYER.help: Name of a group that this layer belongs to. The group name can then be reference as a regular layer name in the template files, allowing to do things like turning on and off a group of layers at once

LAYER.name: LABELITEM
LAYER.help: Item name in attribute table to use for class annotation (i.e. labeling).

LAYER.name: LABELMAXSCALEDENOM
LAYER.help: Minimum scale at which this LAYER is labeled. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000.

LAYER.name: LABELMINSCALEDENOM
LAYER.help: Maximum scale at which this LAYER is labeled. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

LAYER.name: LABELREQUIRES
LAYER.help: Sets context for labeling this layer, for example: LABELREQUIRES "![orthoquads]" means that this layer would NOT be labeled if a layer named [orthoquads] is on

LAYER.name: MASK
LAYER.help: The data from the current layer will only be rendered where it intersects features from the [layername] layer. [layername] must reference the NAME of another LAYER defined in the current mapfile. can be any kind of mapserver layer, i.e. vector or raster. If the current layer has labelling configured, then only labels who's label-point fall inside the unmasked area will be added to the labelcache

LAYER.name: MAXFEATURES
LAYER.help: Specifies the number of features that should be drawn for this layer in the CURRENT window. Has some interesting uses with annotation and with sorted data (i.e. lakes by area)

LAYER.name: MAXSCALEDENOM
LAYER.help: Minimum scale at which this LAYER is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

LAYER.name: MINSCALEDENOM
LAYER.help: Maximum scale at which this LAYER is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

LAYER.name: ZOOM-LEVEL
LAYER.help: Zoom level at which this LAYER is drawn.

LAYER.name: NAME
LAYER.help: Short name for this layer. This name is the link between the mapfile and web interfaces that refer to this name. They must be identical. The name should be unique, unless one layer replaces another at different scales. Use the GROUP option to associate layers with each other. It is recommended that the name not contain spaces, special characters, or begin with a number (which could cause problems through interfaces such as OGC services).

LAYER.name: OFFSITE
LAYER.help: Sets the color index to treat as transparent for raster layers.

LAYER.name: POSTLABELCACHE
LAYER.help: Tells MapServer to render this layer after all labels in the cache have been drawn. Useful for adding neatlines and similar elements. Default is false.

LAYER.name: PROCESSING
LAYER.help: Passes a processing directive to be used with this layer. The supported processing directives vary by layer type, and the underlying driver that processes them

LAYER.name: SIZEUNITS
LAYER.help: Sets the unit of STYLE object SIZE values (default is pixels). Useful for simulating buffering

LAYER.name: STYLEITEM
LAYER.help: Styling based on attributes. <attribute>: Item to use for feature specific styling. The style information may be represented by a separate attribute (style string) attached to the feature.

LAYER.name: STATUS
LAYER.help: Sets the current status of the layer. Often modified by MapServer itself. Default turns the layer on permanently

LAYER.name: SYMBOLSCALEDENOM
LAYER.help: The scale at which symbols and/or text appear full size. This allows for dynamic scaling of objects based on the scale of the map. If not set then this layer will always appear at the same size. Scaling only takes place within the limits of MINSIZE and MAXSIZE

LAYER.name: TOLERANCE
LAYER.help: Sensitivity for point based queries (i.e. via mouse and/or map coordinates). Given in TOLERANCEUNITS. If the layer is a POINT or a LINE, the default is 3. For all other layer types, the default is 0. To restrict polygon searches so that the point must occur in the polygon set the tolerance to zero. This setting does not apply to WFS GetFeature operations

LAYER.name: TOLERANCEUNITS
LAYER.help: Units of the TOLERANCE value. Default is pixels

LAYER.name: TRANSFORM
LAYER.help: Tells MapServer whether or not a particular layer needs to be transformed from some coordinate system to image coordinates. Default is true. This allows you to create shapefiles in image/graphics coordinates and therefore have features that will always be displayed in the same location on every map. Ideal for placing logos or text in maps. Remember that the graphics coordinate system has an origin in the upper left hand corner of the image, contrary to most map coordinate systems.

LAYER.name: TYPE
LAYER.help: Specifies how the data should be drawn. Need not be the same as the shapefile type. For example, a polygon shapefile may be drawn as a point layer, but a point shapefile may not be drawn as a polygon layer. Common sense rules

LAYER.name: UNITS
LAYER.help: Units of the layer

LAYER.name: UTFDATA
LAYER.help: A UTFGrid JSON template. MapServer expression syntax (expressionObj). If no UTFDATA is provided, no data beyond the UTFITEM values will be exposed. If UTFITEM is set, the UTFDATA expose those so that keys and data can be connected

LAYER.name: UTFITEM
LAYER.help: The attribute to use as the ID for the UTFGrid. If a UTFITEM is not set, the sequential id (based on rendering order) is being used. If UTFITEM is set, the UTFDATA expose those so that keys and data can be connected

SCALEBAR.name: BACKGROUNDCOLOR
SCALEBAR.help: Color to use for scalebar background, not the image background.

SCALEBAR.name: COLOR
SCALEBAR.help: Color to use for drawing all features if attribute tables are not used.

SCALEBAR.name: IMAGECOLOR
SCALEBAR.help: Color to initialize the scalebar with (i.e. background).

SCALEBAR.name: INTERVALS
SCALEBAR.help: Number of intervals to break the scalebar into. Default is 4.

SCALEBAR.name: OFFSET
SCALEBAR.help: «OFFSET» moves the scalebar closer to the center of the map

SCALEBAR.name: OUTLINECOLOR
SCALEBAR.help: Color to use for outlining individual intervals. Set any component to -1 for no outline which is the default.

SCALEBAR.name: POSITION
SCALEBAR.help: Where to place an embedded scalebar in the image. Default is lr.

SCALEBAR.name: POSTLABELCACHE
SCALEBAR.help: For use with embedded scalebars only. Tells the MapServer to embed the scalebar after all labels in the cache have been drawn. Default is false.

SCALEBAR.name: SIZE
SCALEBAR.help: Size in pixels of the scalebar. Labeling is not taken into account.

SCALEBAR.name: STATUS
SCALEBAR.help: Is the scalebar image to be created, and if so should it be embedded into the image? Default is off. (Please note that embedding scalebars require that you define a markerset. In essence the scalebar becomes a custom marker that is handled just like any other annotation.)

SCALEBAR.name: STYLE
SCALEBAR.help: Chooses the scalebar style. Valid styles are 0 and 1

SCALEBAR.name: UNITS
SCALEBAR.help: Output scalebar units, default is miles. Used in conjunction with the map's units to develop the actual graphic. Note that decimal degrees are not valid scalebar units

CLASS.name: EXPRESSION
CLASS.help: Expression to define which class a feature belongs to: String comparisons, regular expressions, logical expressions, and string functions (see Expressions<https://mapserver.org/es/mapfile/expressions.html#expressions>). If no expression is given, then all features are said to belong to this class

CLASS.name: GROUP
CLASS.help: Allows for grouping of classes. It is only used when a CLASSGROUP at the LAYER level is set. If the CLASSGROUP parameter is set, only classes that have the same group name would be considered at rendering time

CLASS.name: MAXSCALEDENOM
CLASS.help: Minimum scale at which this CLASS is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

CLASS.name: MINSCALEDENOM
CLASS.help: Maximum scale at which this CLASS is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

CLASS.name: ZOOM-LEVEL
CLASS.help: Zoom level at which this LAYER is drawn.

CLASS.name: NAME
CLASS.help: Name to use in legends for this class. If not set class won't show up in legend

CLASS.name: STATUS
CLASS.help: Sets the current display status of the class. Default turns the class on

CLASS.name: TEXT
CLASS.help: Text to label features in this class with. This overrides values obtained from the LAYER LABELITEM. The string can contain references to feature attributes. This allows you to concatenate multiple attributes into a single label

CLUSTER.name: MAXDISTANCE
CLUSTER.help: Specifies the distance of the search region (rectangle or ellipse) in pixel positions

CLUSTER.name: REGION
CLUSTER.help: Defines the search region around a feature in which the neighbouring features are negotiated. Can be [rectangle] or [ellipse]

CLUSTER.name: BUFFER
CLUSTER.help: Defines a buffer region around the map extent in pixels. Default is 0. Using a buffer allows that the neighbouring shapes around the map are also considered during the cluster creation.

CLUSTER.name: GROUP
CLUSTER.help: This expression evaluates to a string and only the features that have the same group value are negotiated. This parameter can be omitted. The evaluated group value is available in the Â«Cluster_GroupÂ» feature attribute

CLUSTER.name: FILTER
CLUSTER.help: We can define the FILTER expression filter some of the features from the final output. This expression evaluates to a boolean value and if this value is false the corresponding shape is filtered out. This expression is evaluated after the the feature negotiation is completed, therefore the Â«Cluster_FeatureCountÂ» parameter can also be used, which provides the option to filter the shapes having too many or to few neighbors within the search region

COMPOSITE.name: OPACITY
COMPOSITE.help: Sets the opacity level (or the inability to see through the layer) of all classed pixels for a given layer. A value of 100 is opaque and 0 is fully transparent

COMPOSITE.name: COMPOP
COMPOSITE.help: Name of the compositing operator to use when blending the temporary image onto the main map image. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blend_modes. The default compositing operator is [src-over]

FEATURE.name: POINTS
FEATURE.help: A set of xy pairs terminated with an END

FEATURE.name: ITEMS
FEATURE.help: Semicolon separated list of the feature attributes

FEATURE.name: TEXT
FEATURE.help: String to use for labeling this feature

FEATURE.name: WKT
FEATURE.help: A geometry expressed in OpenGIS Well Known Text geometry format. This feature is only supported if MapServer is built with OGR or GEOS support.

GRID.name: LABELFORMAT
GRID.help: Format of the label. [DD] for degrees, [DDMM] for degrees minutes, and [DDMMSS] for degrees, minutes, seconds. A C-style formatting string is also allowed, such as Â«%gÂ°Â» to show decimal degrees with a degree symbol. The default is decimal display of whatever SRS you're rendering the GRID wit

GRID.name: MINARCS
GRID.help: The minimum number of arcs to draw. Increase this parameter to get more lines. Optional.

GRID.name: MAXARCS
GRID.help: The maximum number of arcs to draw. Decrease this parameter to get fewer lines. Optional.

GRID.name: MININTERVAL
GRID.help: The minimum number of intervals to try to use. The distance between the grid lines, in the units of the grid's coordinate system. Optional.

GRID.name: MAXINTERVAL
GRID.help: The maximum number of intervals to try to use. The distance between the grid lines, in the units of the grid's coordinate system. Optional.

GRID.name: MINSUBDIVIDE
GRID.help: The minimum number of segments to use when rendering an arc. If the lines should be very curved, use this to smooth the lines by adding more segments. Optional.

GRID.name: MAXSUBDIVIDE
GRID.help: The maximum number of segments to use when rendering an arc. If the graticule should be very straight, use this to minimize the number of points for faster rendering. Optional, default 256.

STYLE.name: ANGLE
STYLE.help: Angle, given in degrees, to rotate the symbol (counter clockwise). Default is 0 (no rotation). If you have an attribute that specifies angles in a clockwise direction (compass direction), you have to adjust the angle attribute values before they reach MapServer (360-ANGLE), as it is not possible to use a mathematical expression for ANGLE

STYLE.name: ANTIALIAS
STYLE.help: Should TrueType fonts be antialiased. Only useful for GD (gif) rendering. Default is false. Has no effect for the other renderers (where anti-aliasing can not be turned off).

STYLE.name: COLOR
STYLE.help: Color to use for drawing features. If COLOR is not specified, and it is not a SYMBOL of TYPE pixmap, then the symbol will not be rendered.

STYLE.name: COLORRANGE
STYLE.help: Defines two colors to correspond to the low and high ends of the DATARANGE values. Colors are mapped to a continuous linear gradient between the two values.

STYLE.name: DATARANGE
STYLE.help: Defines two values, a low value and a high value, that Mapserver will map to the color range defined by the COLORRANGE entry. Values must be integers or doubles. Colors are mapped to a continuous linear gradient between the two values.

STYLE.name: GAP
STYLE.help: GAP specifies the distance between SYMBOLs (center to center) for decorated lines and polygon fills in layer SIZEUNITS. For polygon fills, GAP specifies the distance between SYMBOLs in both the X and the Y direction. For lines, the centers of the SYMBOLs are placed on the line. As of MapServer 5.0 this also applies to PixMap symbols.

STYLE.name: GEOMTRANSFORM
STYLE.help: Used to indicate that the current feature will be transformed before the actual style is applied.

STYLE.name: INITIALGAP
STYLE.help: INITIALGAP is useful for styling dashed lines. If used with GAP, INITIALGAP specifies the distance to the first symbol on a styled line. If used with PATTERN, INITIALGAP specifies the distance to the first dash on a dashed line.

STYLE.name: LINECAP
STYLE.help: Sets the line cap type for lines. Default is round.

STYLE.name: LINEJOIN
STYLE.help: Sets the line join type for lines. Default is round.

STYLE.name: LINEJOINMAXSIZE
STYLE.help: Sets the max length of the miter LINEJOIN type. The value represents a coefficient which multiplies a current symbol size. Default is 3.

STYLE.name: MAXSCALEDENOM
STYLE.help: Minimum scale at which this STYLE is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000.

STYLE.name: MINSCALEDENOM
STYLE.help: Maximum scale at which this STYLE is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

STYLE.name: ZOOM-LEVEL
STYLE.help: Zoom level at which this LAYER is drawn.

STYLE.name: MAXSIZE
STYLE.help: Maximum size in pixels to draw a symbol. Default is 500.

STYLE.name: MINSIZE
STYLE.help: Minimum size in pixels to draw a symbol. Default is 0.

STYLE.name: MAXWIDTH
STYLE.help: Maximum width in pixels to draw the line work. Default is 32.

STYLE.name: MINWIDTH
STYLE.help: Minimum width in pixels to draw the line work. Default is 0.

STYLE.name: OFFSET
STYLE.help: Geometry offset values in layer SIZEUNITS. In the general case, SIZEUNITS will be pixels.

STYLE.name: OPACITY
STYLE.help: Opacity to draw the current style.

STYLE.name: OUTLINECOLOR
STYLE.help: Color to use for outlining polygons and certain marker symbols. Has no effect for lines. The width of the outline can be specified using WIDTH. If no WIDTH is specified, an outline of one pixel will be drawn.

STYLE.name: OUTLINEWIDTH
STYLE.help: Width in pixels for the outline. Default is 0.0. The thickness of the outline will not depend on the scale.

STYLE.name: POLAROFFSET
STYLE.help: Offset given in polar coordinates. The first parameter is a double value in layer SIZEUNITS (or the name of a layer attribute) that specifies the radius/distance. The second parameter is a double value (or the name of a layer attribute) that specifies the angle (counter clockwise).

STYLE.name: RANGEITEM
STYLE.help: Specifies the attribute that will be used to map colors between the high and low ends of the COLORRANGE entry. Colors are mapped to a continuous linear gradient between the two values.

STYLE.name: SIZE
STYLE.help: Height, in layer SIZEUNITS, of the symbol/pattern to be used. Default value depends on the SYMBOL TYPE. For pixmap: the height (in pixels) of the pixmap; for ellipse and vector: the maximum y value of the SYMBOL POINTS parameter, for hatch: 1.0, for truetype: 1.0.

STYLE.name: SYMBOL
STYLE.help: The symbol to use for rendering the features.

STYLE.name: WIDTH
STYLE.help: WIDTH refers to the thickness of line work drawn, in layer SIZEUNITS. Default is 1.0.

LABEL.name: ALIGN
LABEL.help: Specifies text alignment for multiline labels (see WRAP) Note that the alignment algorithm is far from precise, so don't expect fabulous results (especially for right alignment) if you're not using a fixed width font

LABEL.name: ANGLE
LABEL.help: Angle to draw the label. [FOLLOW] tells MapServer to compute a curved label for appropriate linear features. [AUTO] allows MapServer to compute the angle. Valid for LINE layers only

LABEL.name: ANTIALIAS
LABEL.help: Should text be antialiased? Note that this requires more available colors, decreases drawing performance, and results in slightly larger output images. Only useful for GD (gif) rendering. Default is false. Has no effect for the other renderers (where anti-aliasing can not be turned off).

LABEL.name: BACKGROUNDCOLOR
LABEL.help: Color to draw a background rectangle (i.e. billboard). Off by default

LABEL.name: BACKGROUNDSHADOWCOLOR
LABEL.help: Color to draw a background rectangle (i.e. billboard) shadow. Off by default.

LABEL.name: BACKGROUNDSHADOWSIZE
LABEL.help: How far should the background rectangle be offset? Default is 1.

LABEL.name: BUFFER
LABEL.help: Padding, in pixels, around labels. Useful for maintaining spacing around text to enhance readability. Available only for cached labels. Default is 0.

LABEL.name: COLOR
LABEL.help: Color to draw text

LABEL.name: EXPRESSION
LABEL.help: Expression that determines when the LABEL is to be applied

LABEL.name: FONT
LABEL.help: Font alias (as defined in the FONTSET) to use for labeling. May contain a comma-separated list of up to MS_MAX_LABEL_FONTS (usually 5) font aliases used as fallback fonts in renderers supporting it, if a glyph is not available in a font. If specified directly, be sure to enclose the list with quotes

LABEL.name: FORCE
LABEL.help: Forces labels for a particular class on, regardless of collisions. Available only for cached labels. Default is false. If FORCE is true and PARTIALS is false, FORCE takes precedence, and partial labels are drawn.

LABEL.name: MAXLENGTH
LABEL.help: This keyword interacts with the WRAP keyword so that line breaks only occur after the defined number of characters

LABEL.name: MAXSIZE
LABEL.help: Maximum font size to use when scaling text (pixels). Default is 256. Starting from version 5.4, the value can also be a fractional value (and not only integer). See LAYER SYMBOLSCALEDENOM.

LABEL.name: MINDISTANCE
LABEL.help: Minimum distance between duplicate labels. Given in pixels. Starting from version 7.2, the distance is calculated from the label boundary.

LABEL.name: MINFEATURESIZE
LABEL.help: Minimum size a feature must be to be labeled. Given in pixels. For line data the overall length of the displayed line is used, for polygons features the smallest dimension of the bounding box is used. [Auto] keyword tells MapServer to only label features that are larger than their corresponding label. Available for cached labels only

LABEL.name: MAXSCALEDENOM
LABEL.help: Minimum scale at which this LABEL is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000.

LABEL.name: MINSCALEDENOM
LABEL.help: Maximum scale at which this LABEL is drawn. Scale is given as the denominator of the actual scale fraction, for example for a map at a scale of 1:24,000 use 24000

LABEL.name: ZOOM-LEVEL
LABEL.help: Zoom level at which this LAYER is drawn.

LABEL.name: MINSIZE
LABEL.help: Minimum font size to use when scaling text (pixels). Default is 4. Starting from version 5.4, the value can also be a fractional value (and not only integer). See LAYER SYMBOLSCALEDENOM.

LABEL.name: OFFSET
LABEL.help: Offset values for labels, relative to the lower left hand corner of the label and the label point. Given in pixels. In the case of rotated text specify the values as if all labels are horizontal and any rotation will be compensated for.

LABEL.name: OUTLINECOLOR
LABEL.help: Color to draw a one pixel outline around the characters in the text.

LABEL.name: OUTLINEWIDTH
LABEL.help: Width of the outline if OUTLINECOLOR has been set. Defaults to 1. Currently only the AGG renderer supports values greater than 1, and renders these as a Â«haloÂ» effect: recommended values are 3 or 5. If the renderer supports it and the text size is variable, the outline will be scaled proportionally to the text and the value specified as OUTLINEWIDTH is therefore the width at the same scale at which the SIZE is specified

LABEL.name: PARTIALS
LABEL.help: Can text run off the edge of the map? Default is true. If FORCE is true and PARTIALS is false, FORCE takes precedence, and partial labels are drawn.

LABEL.name: POSITION
LABEL.help: Position of the label relative to the labeling point (layers only). First letter is [Y] position, second letter is [X] position. [Auto] tells MapServer to calculate a label position that will not interfere with other labels. With points, MapServer selects from the 8 outer positions (i.e. excluding cc). With polygons, MapServer selects from cc (added in MapServer 5.4), uc, lc, cl and cr as possible positions. With lines, it only uses lc or uc, until it finds a position that doesn't collide with labels that have already been drawn. If all positions cause a conflict, then the label is not drawn (Unless the label's FORCE a parameter is set to [true]).

LABEL.name: PRIORITY
LABEL.help: The priority parameter takes an integer value between 1 (lowest) and 10 (highest). The default value is 1. It is also possible to bind the priority to an attribute (item_name) using square brackets around the [item_name]. e.g. [PRIORITY [someattribute]]

LABEL.name: REPEATDISTANCE
LABEL.help: The label will be repeated on every line of a multiline shape and will be repeated multiple times along a given line at an interval of REPEATDISTANCE pixels.

LABEL.name: SIZE
LABEL.help: Text size. Use a number to give the size in pixels of your TrueType font based label, or any of the other 5 listed keywords for bitmap fonts.

LABEL.name: SHADOWCOLOR
LABEL.help: Color of drop shadow. A label with the same text will be rendered in this color before the main label is drawn, resulting in a shadow effect on the the label characters. The offset of the renderered shadow is set with SHADOWSIZE.

LABEL.name: SHADOWSIZE
LABEL.help: Shadow offset in pixels, see SHADOWCOLOR.

LABEL.name: TEXT
LABEL.help: Text to label features with (useful when multiple labels are used). Overrides values obtained from the LAYER LABELITEM and the CLASS TEXT.

LABEL.name: TYPE
LABEL.help: Type of font to use. Generally bitmap fonts are faster to draw then TrueType fonts. However, TrueType fonts are scalable and available in a variety of faces. Be sure to set the FONT parameter if you select TrueType

LABEL.name: WRAP
LABEL.help: Character that represents an end-of-line condition in label text, thus resulting in a multi-line label. Interacts with MAXLENGTH for conditional line wrapping after a given number of characters

LEADER.name: GRIDSTEP
LEADER.help: Specifies the number of pixels between positions that are tested for a label line. You might start with a value of 5, and increase depending on performance

LEADER.name: MAXDISTANCE
LEADER.help: Specifies the maximum distance in pixels from the normal label location that a leader line can be drawn. You might start with a value of 30, and increase depending on the resulting placement

LEGEND.name: IMAGECOLOR
LEGEND.help: Color to initialize the legend with (i.e. the background)

LEGEND.name: KEYSIZE
LEGEND.help: Size of symbol key boxes in pixels. Default is 20 by 10

LEGEND.name: KEYSPACING
LEGEND.help: Spacing between symbol key boxes ([y]) and labels ([x]) in pixels. Default is 5 by 5.

LEGEND.name: OUTLINECOLOR
LEGEND.help: Color to use for outlining symbol key boxes.

LEGEND.name: POSITION
LEGEND.help: Where to place an embedded legend in the map. Default is lr.

LEGEND.name: POSTLABELCACHE
LEGEND.help: Tells MapServer to render this legend after all labels in the cache have been drawn. Useful for adding neatlines and similar elements. Default is false.

LEGEND.name: STATUS
LEGEND.help: Is the legend image to be created.
